messages.title: Change in Wirral West
messages.content: The re-election of Gordon Brown's government - with more debt, waste and tax - will bring us a new recession.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans to create 450,000 new apprenticeships, college and training places, while particularly addressing local needs like the Lairdside Training Centre and opportunities by Wirral Council and its partners.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Labour’s Tax on Jobs Will Kill the Recovery
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to tax increases that would purportedly waste money and result in lost jobs.
The NHS is stated as the number one priority, with plans to cut waste and improve services. It mentions Conservative will increase spending on the NHS every year.

mentions.tacticalSituation: After a 6-month battle to Save Girtrell Fire Station from the cuts proposed by a local council and the much welcome news that Hoylake’s lifeguard station will stay open for another year.

issues.economy: Mention of the dangers of a new recession under Gordon Brown's government with more debt, waste and tax.
issues.health: Improving the NHS is emphasized as a key issue, with promises to increase spending on the NHS each year and ensure it is free from waste and bureaucracy.

housing.content: Improvements to mortgage payments lower under the Conservatives than under Labour, and help for first-time buyers to get onto the property ladder.

politicalExperience.achievements: Chris Grayling opposes Hoylake at the heart of antisocial behavior and late night licensing.

contactInformation.address: 36A Market Street, Hoylake, Wirral, Merseyside, CH47 2AF

images.caption: Esther teamed up with residents to rebuild Meols Park.
Esther has been working with local builders and traders.
